meanings.definition: To make or become Bolshevik in character or outlook.
meanings.sent1: The group bolshevized their ideas, becoming more radical in their beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The country slowly bolshevized, adopting a more socialist approach to governance.
meanings.sent3: The classroom suddenly bolshevized when the teacher introduced a new, revolutionary project.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe bolshevized overnight, transforming into a collection of bold, red outfits.
meanings.sent5: The garden bolshevized with colorful flowers, resembling a vibrant political rally.

meanings.definition: To bring under Bolshevik control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The dictator bolshevized the media, ensuring only pro-government messages were spread.
meanings.sent2: The political party aimed to bolshevize the trade unions, gaining more support for their cause.
meanings.sent3: The prankster jokingly bolshevized the office fridge, labeling all the food as 'property of the state'.
meanings.sent4: The artist bolshevized the art scene, introducing bold propaganda-inspired pieces.
meanings.sent5: The storm bolshevized the peaceful town, bringing in a wave of revolutionary change.
